general.label: Mode
tip: Cache modes:
<ul>
• Partitioned - in this mode the overall key set will be divided into partitions and all partitions will be split equally between participating nodes.
• Replicated - in this mode all the keys are distributed to all participating nodes.
• Local - in this mode caches residing on different grid nodes will not know about each other.

general.label: Atomicity
tip: Atomicity:
<ul>
• Transactional - in this mode specified fully ACID-compliant transactional cache behavior.
• Atomic - in this mode distributed transactions and distributed locking are not supported.

general.label: Backups
tip: Number of nodes used to back up single partition for partitioned cache.

fields.label: Mode
tip: Memory modes:
<ul>
<li>ONHEAP_TIERED - entries are cached on heap memory first.
<ul>
• If offheap memory is enabled and eviction policy evicts an entry from heap memory, entry will be moved to offheap memory. If offheap memory is disabled, then entry is simply discarded.

• If swap space is enabled and offheap memory fills up, then entry will be evicted into swap space. If swap space is disabled, then entry will be discarded. If swap is enabled and offheap memory is disabled, then entry will be evicted directly from heap memory into swap.

• OFFHEAP_TIERED - works the same as ONHEAP_TIERED, except that entries never end up in heap memory and get stored in offheap memory right away. Entries get cached in offheap memory first and then get evicted to swap, if one is configured.
• OFFHEAP_VALUES - entry keys will be stored on heap memory, and values will be stored in offheap memory. Note that in this mode entries can be evicted only to swap.

fields.label: Off-heap max memory
tip: Sets maximum amount of memory available to off-heap storage.
Possible values are:
<ul>
• -1 - means that off-heap storage is disabled.
• 0 - Ignite will not limit off-heap storage (it's up to user to properly add and remove entries from cache to ensure that off-heap storage does not grow infinitely.
• Any positive value specifies the limit of off-heap storage in bytes.

fields.label: Escape all
tip: If set then all the SQL table and field names will be escaped with double quotes.
This enforces case sensitivity for field names and also allows having special characters in table and field names.

fields.label: Cached rows
tip: Number of SQL rows which will be cached onheap to avoid deserialization on each SQL index access.

fields.label: Long query timeout
tip: Timeout in milliseconds after which long query warning will be printed.
Collection of types to index.

fields.label: SQL function
tip: Classes with user-defined functions for SQL queries.

fields.label: Mode
tip: Rebalance modes:
<ul>
• Synchronous - in this mode distributed caches will not start until all necessary data is loaded from other available grid nodes.
• Asynchronous - in this mode entries never end up in heap memory and get stored in offheap memory right away.
• None - in this mode entry keys will be stored on heap memory, and values will be stored in offheap memory.

fields.label: Pool size
tip: Size of rebalancing thread pool.
Note that size serves as a hint and implementation may create more threads for rebalancing than specified here (but never less threads).

fields.label: Batch size
tip: Size (in bytes) to be loaded within a single rebalance message.
Rebalancing algorithm will split total data set on every node into multiple batches prior to sending data.

fields.label: Order
tip: If cache rebalance order is positive, rebalancing for this cache will be started only when rebalancing
for all caches with smaller rebalance order (except caches with rebalance order 0) will be completed.

fields.label: Delay
tip: Delay in milliseconds upon a node joining or leaving topology (or crash) after which rebalancing should be started automatically.

fields.label: Timeout
tip: Rebalance timeout (ms).

fields.label: Throttle
tip: Time in milliseconds to wait between rebalance messages to avoid overloading of CPU or network.

fields.label: Store factory
tip: Factory for persistent storage for cache data.

fields.label: Data source bean
tip: Name of the data source bean in Spring context.

fields.label: Dialect
tip: Dialect of SQL implemented by a particular RDBMS:
<ul>
• Generic JDBC dialect.
• Oracle database.
• IBM DB2.
• Microsoft SQL Server.
• My SQL.
• H2 database.

fields.label: user
tip: User name for database access.

fields.label: Data source bean
tip: Name of the data source bean in Spring context.

fields.label: Init schema
tip: Flag indicating whether DB schema should be initialized by Ignite (default behaviour) or was explicitly created by user.

fields.label: Create query
fields.placeholder: create table if not exists ENTRIES (key binary primary key, val binary)
tip: Default query for table creation in underlying database.
create table if not exists ENTRIES (key binary primary key, val binary)

fields.label: Load query
tip: Default load entry query from underlying database.
select * from ENTRIES where key=?

fields.label: insert query
tip: Default insert entry query to underlying database.
insert into ENTRIES (key, val) values (?, ?)

fields.label: Update query
fields.placeholder: update ENTRIES set val=? where key=?
tip: Default update entry query to underlying database.
update ENTRIES set val=? where key=?

fields.label: Delete query
tip: Default delete entry query to underlying database.
delete from ENTRIES where key=?

fields.label: Hibernate property
tip: List of Hibernate properties.
For example: connection.url=jdbc:h2:mem:

fields.label: Read-through
tip: Flag indicating whether read-through caching should be used.

fields.label: Write-through
tip: Flag indicating whether write-through caching should be used.

fields.label: Invalidate
tip: Invalidation flag for near cache entries in transaction.
If set then values will be invalidated (nullified) upon commit in near cache.

fields.label: Default lock timeout
tip: Default lock acquisition timeout.
If 0 then lock acquisition will never timeout.

fields.label: Manager finder
tip: Class name of transaction manager finder for integration for JEE app servers.

fields.label: Enabled
tip: Flag indicating whether Ignite should use write-behind behaviour for the cache store.

fields.label: Batch size
tip: Maximum batch size for write-behind cache store operations.
Store operations (get or remove) are combined in a batch of this size to be passed to cache store.

fields.label: Flush size
tip: Maximum size of the write-behind cache.
If cache size exceeds this value, all cached items are flushed to the cache store and write cache is cleared.

fields.label: Flush frequency
tip: Frequency with which write-behind cache is flushed to the cache store in milliseconds.

fields.label: Flush threads count
tip: Number of threads that will perform cache flushing.

fields.label: Statistics enabled
tip: Flag indicating whether statistics gathering is enabled on a cache.

fields.label: Management enabled
tip: Flag indicating whether management is enabled on this cache.

fields.label: Read from backup
tip: Flag indicating whether data can be read from backup.
If not set then always get data from primary node (never from backup).

fields.label: Copy on read
tip: Flag indicating whether copy of of the value stored in cache should be created for cache operation implying return value.
Also if this flag is set copies are created for values passed to CacheInterceptor and to CacheEntryProcessor.

fields.label: Max async concurrency
tip: Maximum number of allowed concurrent asynchronous operations.
If 0 returned then number of concurrent asynchronous operations is unlimited.
